com.pump.swing

Class GradientSlider

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • com.pump.swing.MultiThumbSlider<java.awt.Color>
            • com.pump.swing.GradientSlider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class GradientSlider
extends MultiThumbSlider<java.awt.Color>
    This component lets the user manipulate the colors in a gradient. A GradientSlider can contain any number of thumbs. The slider itself represents a range of values from zero to one, so the thumbs must always be within this range. Each thumb maps to a specific Color.

    There are some specific properties you can set to customize the look-and-feel of this slider in the default GradientSliderUI class.

    The UI for each slider is loaded from the UIManager property: "GradientSliderUI". By default this is "com.pump.plaf.GradientSliderUI".

    The GradientSliderDemoHelper creates this sample graphic:

    See Also:
    com.pump.swing.GradientSliderDemo, Serialized Form

      • GradientSlider

        public GradientSlider(int orientation,
                      float[] thumbPositions,
                      java.awt.Color[] values)
        Create a new GradientSlider.
        Parameters:
        orientation - HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL
        thumbPositions - the initial positions of each thumb
        values - the initial colors at each position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of elements in thumbPositions does not equal the number of elements in values.

      • createValueForInsertion

        public java.awt.Color createValueForInsertion(float pos)
        Description copied from class: MultiThumbSlider
        This creates a new value for insertion.

        If the pos argument is outside the domain of thumbs, then a value still needs to be returned.

        Overrides:
        createValueForInsertion in class MultiThumbSlider<java.awt.Color>
        Parameters:
        pos - a position between zero and one
        Returns:
        the Color at the specified position.
